data.name: Find Which Numbers Can Build a Sum
data.description:
Use the function ***upto*** to calculate all the ways to sum up integers from a list into the *wanted_sum*. If no list is given, use a list with the numbers 1-9 instead. If no combination is possible, return an empty list ## Variables **wanted_sum** => The sum which you want to add up to. **nums** => The amount of numbers to add up to the *wanted_sum* **num_list** => The list of integers that you'll search for a set amount of digits(*nums*) that add up to the *wanted_sum*, if not set, a list of the digits 1-9 should be used instead, with no duplicates. ## Examples ```Python # Which ways 12 can be built by 3 of the digits 1,2,3,5,6,7,8 upto(12, 3, [1,2,3,5,6,7,8]) # => [(1, 3, 8), (1, 5, 6), (2, 3, 7)] # Calculating how 4 numbers from the default range (1-9) can build into 12 upto(10, 4)# [(1, 2, 3, 4)] # Getting all the possible means that 3 numbers from 1-9 can build build 9 upto(9, 3)# [(1, 2, 6), (1, 3, 5), (2, 3, 4)] ```


>This kata is based on stage 1 of a program I made to help me with Killer Sudoku and Kakuro >![Killer Sudoku](https://i.ibb.co/pPtV8Dq/Killer-Sudoku.png)
